alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 25 at 12:32AM EDT until August 25 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL ASHLAND AND CENTRAL WAYNE COUNTIES... At 1232 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 8 miles west of Wooster, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Wooster around 1240 AM EDT. Shreve around 1245 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Rowsburg, Reedsburg, Smithville, Apple Creek and Jeromesville. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
